title: Ticket #4148: Pass non-fungible slot resource IDs to the job via environment
description:
User-defined slot resources that have resource IDs, (i.e. are non-fungible) must be published to the Starter and/or job in order to be useful. See #4141

There should be a way for the configurator to define what environment variable to publish a given resource id into.

To take the particular case of GPU resources, the config 

    # add this to your config file to define 4 non-fungible GPU resources
    MACHINE_RESOURCE_GPUs = CUDA0,CUDA1,CUDA2,CUDA3

Will result in slots being assigned GPUs resources, the specific IDs of which are published in the slot ad in the AssignedGPUs attribute. This will be a comma separated list, so a slot that is assigned 2 GPUs might have this attribute in it's machine ad. 

    AssignedGPUs = "CUDA0,CUDA1"

When a job lands on this slot, the assigned GPUs will be propagated into the job's environment as: 

    _CONDOR_AssignedGPUs=CUDA0,CUDA1

But in order to work the NVIDIA's CUDA api, it also need to be published to the job's environment as CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES environment variable, with everything but the device numbers removed like this (see #2011) 

    _CONDOR_AssignedGPUs=CUDA0,CUDA1
    CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=0,1

To get this behavior, you can add the optional configuration to specify an additional environment variable for assigned resources. HTCondor recognizes CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES and the OpenCL equivalent GPU_DEVICE_ORDINAL and will strip all but [0-9,] from AssignedGPU before assigning it to one of these 

    # this config produces the above environment
    MACHINE_RESOURCE_GPUs = CUDA0,CUDA1,CUDA2,CUDA3
    ENVIRONMENT_FOR_AssignedGPUs = CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES


    # this config is equivalent, but makes the transformation of IDs explicit
    MACHINE_RESOURCE_GPUs = CUDA0,CUDA1,CUDA2,CUDA3
    ENVIRONMENT_FOR_AssignedGPUs = CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=/[ a-zA-Z]+//

This is generalized so that for this configuration 

    # config a tag resource
    MACHINE_RESOURCE_Tag = VINI, VICI, VIDI
    ENVIRONMENT_FOR_AssignedTag = WHAT_I_DID=/$/I_/
    NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_1 = 1
    SLOT_TYPE_1_PARTITIONABLE = true
    SLOT_TYPE_1 = Cpus=100%, Disk=90%, Memory=90%, Tag=100%

A job that requests a Tag resource like this 

    # this is in the jobs submit file
    request_tag = 1

Then the dynamic slot that is used to satisfy the job request will have these attributes 

    TotalTag = 3
    DetectedTag = 3
    TotalSlotTag = 1
    Tag = 1
    AssignedTag = "VINI"

And when the job starts on that slot, the job's environment will contain. 

    _CONDOR_AssignedTag=VINI
    WHAT_I_DID=I_VINI
remarks:
2014-Jan-24 10:08:49 by johnkn:
ENVIRONMENT_FOR_AssignedTag needs way to indicate string substitution operations on the right hand side, something like 

    ENVIRONMENT_FOR_AssignedGPUs = CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=/CUDA//

which would indicate that CUDA should be removed from the device ID before assigning it to the CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES environment variable.

If the slot has 

    AssignedGPUs = "CUDA2,CUDA3"

Then the job environment will have 

    _CONDOR_AssignedGPUs=CUDA1,CUDA2
    CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=1,2

2014-Jan-30 10:19:10 by johnkn:
[39261] added a new config knob for each non-fungible user defined resource FOO there is a config koob ENVIRONMENT_FOR_AssignedFOO which can contain a set of environment variables and associated perl style regex replacement rule for converting assigned FOO ids when setting that environment variable.

If there is a user defined resource 

   # configuration
   MACHINE_RESOURCE_FOO = "IDA,IDB,IDC"
   ENVIRONMENT_FOR_AssignedFOO = MYFOO=/ID([A-Z])/"$1"/  FOO2=/ID// FOO3

Then when a slot gets assigned a Foo, the machine ad will have 

   # machine/slot ad
   FOO = 2
   AssignedFOO = "IDA,IDB"

And the job environment will have 

   _CONDOR_AssignedFOO=IDA,IDB
   MYFOO="A","B"
   FOO2=A,B
   FOO3=IDA,IDB
